alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 5:38PM CDT until May 17 at 1:34PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Humble, Aldine, Northside / Northline, Greater Greenspoint, Near Northside Houston, Spring Branch North, Spring Branch West, East Little York / Homestead, Eastex / Jensen Area, Houston Gardens, East Houston, southern Bush Intercontinental Airport, Settegast, Hidden Valley, Independence Heights, Acres Home, southern Atascocita, Central Northwest, Lazybrook / Timbergrove and Lake Houston Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
